results.definition: a tentative insight into the natural world; a concept that is not yet verified but that if true would explain certain facts or phenomena
examples: a scientific hypothesis that survives experimental testing becomes a scientific theory
he proposed a fresh theory of alkalis that later was accepted in chemical practices

results.definition: a belief that can guide behavior
examples: the architect has a theory that more is less
they killed him on the theory that dead men tell no tales

results.definition: a well-substantiated explanation of some aspect of the natural world; an organized system of accepted knowledge that applies in a variety of circumstances to explain a specific set of phenomena
